agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides outpatient medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction utilizing methadone and buprenorphine.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioids. Services include medications, counseling, and referrals to other agencies as needed. Group, individual, and family addictions counseling is available.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment,
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization proving therapeutic riding and a equestrian therapy program.
service_description: Provides therapeutic riding and a equestrian therapy program for disabled individuals and children, at-risk youth, veterans, senior citizens, and individuals with a substance use disorder.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or send an email to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Individuals age three or older -- Individuals with physical disabilities -- Individuals with intellectual disabilities -- Individuals with emotional and behavioral disabilities -- Individuals with social disabilities

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call the Shalom Center for information -OR - Walk in for an assessment. No appointments are available; walk-ins are seen on a first come first served basis.
site_eligibility: Serves Greene, Lawrence, Martin, Monroe, Morgan, or Owen County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_desc: A program in conjunction with the Monroe County Public Library and the City of Bloomington Council for Community Accessibility that provides free mobility devices to those in need.
site_name: MOBILITY AIDS LENDING LIBRARY AT MONROE COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY
service_description: Provides free mobility aids such as canes, walkers, and wheelchairs on a temporary or permanent basis to those in need. Available equipment is dependent on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Visit https://tinyurl.com/mallbloomingtonneed and fill out the mobility aid need form. -- Contact mallbloomington@gmail.com for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- In need of mobility aid equipment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing harm reduction outreach services and recovery support in Indiana.
service_name: HARM REDUCTION SERVICES - SHALOM COMMUNITY CENTER
service_description: Offers harm reduction services, including free naloxone access, syringe access and disposal, safe sex supplies, referrals for HIV/HCV testing and treatment, and advocacy. Services are provided anonymously.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For supplies: Walk in during designated hours. -- Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing harm reduction outreach services and recovery support in Indiana.
service_description: Offers harm reduction services, including free naloxone access, syringe access and disposal, safe sex supplies, referrals for HIV/HCV testing and treatment, and advocacy. Services are provided anonymously. Services are provided anonymously.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For supplies: Walk in during designated hours. -- Visit website, send email, or call for information.

agency_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR RURAL ENGAGEMENT
agency_desc: An academic center of Indiana University addressing the challenges impacting Indiana communities. Services include enhancing opportunities in collaboration with communities and leading partnerships between non-land-grant, research institutions, and rural communities.
site_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR RURAL ENGAGEMENT
service_description: Collaborates with rural communities and organizations to address local opportunities and needs.
site_details: Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers self-help support groups, networking and information throughout the state in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences.
service_description: Offers self-help support groups in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences. This area has meetings at various locations in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, Montgomery, and Shelby County.
site_details: Call or visit website for meeting times and locations. -- Call and leave a message to receive a call-back from a recovering addict. -- All meetings are walk-in only.
site_schedule: Automated Information Line: Daily 24 Hours -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Closed Meetings: Addicts or those who think they may have a drug problem -- Open Meetings: Anyone wishing to experience narcotics anonymous fellowship

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA - BLOOMINGTON
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA - BLOOMINGTON
service_description: Works with individuals, state, and national groups to disseminate information about child abuse prevention. Offers publications, brochures, and pamphlets on child abuse prevention and parenting. Public speakers and educational presentations are available for schools and other organizations.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Indiana; speakers/presentations are available to schools and nonprofit organizations

agency_desc: A non-denominational, Christian social services organization that provides goods and services to the homeless, poor, and needy.
service_description: Provides short-term emergency housing for men only and dayroom services (three daily meals and showers) for men and women.
site_details:
Day Services (Men and Women): Walk in Mon-Sun between 7am-8pm -- Women must leave at 8pm

Evening Shelter Services (Men only): Walk in Mon-Sun between 7am-9:30pm
site_schedule:
Day Services: Mon-Sun 7am-8pm -- Meals 7am, 12 noon, and 5pm

Evening Shelter Services: Mon-Sun Must arrive by 9:30pm
site_eligibility:
Day Services: Adult men or women -- Must be able to manage daily activities (getting dressed, eating, using the restroom, showering) without assistance 

Evening Shelter Services: Adult men -- Must be able to manage daily activities (getting dressed, eating, using the restroom, showering) without assistance -- Not listed on the sex offender registry

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Assists income-eligible taxpayers in resolving tax disputes with the Internal Revenue Service. Free legal consultation and representation may be available for tax issues such as liens and levies, exams and audits, payment plans, collection alternatives, innocent spouse relief, and tax court cases.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Primarily serves persons with household income at or below 250% Federal Poverty Level (some exceptions may apply) -- Requiring assistance with tax issues

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during office hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil, non-fee-generating legal issue

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides transitional housing for low-income domestic violence survivors and their children. Supportive services, including youth services, are available for participants. Program participation is up to 2 years.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: Individuals age 18 or older, with children -- Homeless as a result of domestic violence -- Below 50% Area Median Income -- With a source of income within 30 days of residence

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides shelter to individuals and individuals with their minor children seeking safe housing because of domestic violence or sexual assault. Support services include advocacy, case management, support groups for victims and their children, and legal assistance (protective orders, divorces, and victim assistance). Childcare is sometimes avaiable.
site_details: Call the crisis line.
site_eligibility: Survivors (with or without children) of domestic violence, sexual violence, or human trafficking.

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides victim assistance and crisis response to both male and female victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, or sexual assault. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. A 24-hour hotline is available to answer questions about domestic violence or sexual assault, assist victims in preparing safety plans, and provide information and referrals to area resources.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office/Non-Emergency Walk-ins: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line/Emergency Walk-ins: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, human trafficking and stalking

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit that provides free peer counseling support groups.
service_description: Provides free, Christian-based peer counseling for women, by women who have experienced similar problems. Counselors are not professional therapists, but are lay counselors that have gone through peer training. Areas of ministry include, but are not limited to abuse, childlessness, death, divorce, grief, eating disorders, depression, incarceration, parenting, pregnancy, self-esteem, suicide, and phobias.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website for nearest location and call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Women and teen girls (age 13 or older)

site_eligibility: Ex-offenders

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - HOOSIER TRAILS COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.
site_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA- HOOSIER TRAILS COUNCIL
service_description: Provides a business-themed program in which young men and women explore various careers and work "hands-on" with local businesses. This program is available at several sites throughout the region.
site_details: Call the council office for information about joining the nearest Exploring program.
site_eligibility: Ages 14-20

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
service_description: Offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs in a variety of fields. This public institution is part of the Indiana University system.
site_details: Call or visit website for application information.
site_schedule: Administrative Hours: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Switchboard: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: High school diploma or high school equivalency test -- Successful application

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides food to free food pantries, community kitchens, shelters, and other member agencies. Also runs food programs distributing directly to the public, including senior food boxes and mobile pantries.
service_name: FAMILIES FIRST MOBILE FOOD PANTRY LOCATOR
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Visit agency's website to access list of mobile food pantry locations and times. Lawrence County (Bedford and Mitchell); Martin County (Shoals); and Orange County (Orleans). -- Walk in.
site_schedule: Varies by location; refer to agency's website for locations and times
site_eligibility: Living in Lawrence, Martin, or Orange County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides food to free food pantries, community kitchens, shelters, and other member agencies. Also runs food programs distributing directly to the public, including senior food boxes and mobile pantries.
service_description: Senior clients receive 40 pounds of food each month, including high-protein items, grains, vegetables, fruit, juices, and shelf-stable milk.  Delivery not provided by Hoosier Hills.
site_details: Call to speak with Sydney Graham for information or to enroll.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Current household income (from all sources) at or below 130% of Federal Poverty Guidelines --Participants must be re-certified every six months in person --  Clients may arrange for a proxy to pick up food packages on their behalf

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides food to free food pantries, community kitchens, shelters, and other member agencies. Also runs food programs distributing directly to the public, including senior food boxes and mobile pantries.
service_description: Solicits, collects, and stores donated food and critical grocery products and redistributes them ONLY to 501(c)(3) charities feeding the hungry at no charge.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Agencies with 501(c)(3) tax exempt rating

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_schedule: Men's Classes: Fri 4pm and 6:30pm -- Women: Fri noon
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_name: SALT CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: SALT CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides up to one month's payment on rent, mortgage, or utility bill for eligible Monroe County households experiencing a temporary financial crisis. No assistance is provided through this agency for deposit or reconnection fees.
site_details: Call and select extension 15 to leave a message, including contact information. Appointments are scheduled on a call-back basis. (Note: To be eligible, clients must first have requested assistance from their township trustee.) -- Applications available online: www.mcum.org/ssc/financialassistance
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Experiencing a temporary financial crisis (Account must be past-due) -- Must apply for assistance with the township trustee first (for the same need and within the same month) -- Ability to demonstrate an income source and that the need is temporary -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the past 12 months

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides small low-barrier, personal loans to community members who lack access to traditional sources of affordable credit. The loan is repayable in small, manageable payments that are determined on a sliding scale based on household income. This program cannot be used to cover rent, utility, or childcare fees at MCUM's Compass Early Learning Center. Payment is made directly to the company or agency and not to the client.
site_details: Call and select extension 15 to leave a message, including contact information. Appointments are scheduled on a call-back basis. -- Applications available online: www.mcum.org/ssc/microloans
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Loan must be fir a one-time expense that is not covered by another program -- Must have current income (earned or unearned) -- Must have an active bank account -- Ability to make small monthly payments

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides an innovative coaching program designed to motivate participants to achieve their goals and increase economic mobility. Whether it is getting a better-paying job, finishing your education, finding more stable and affordable housing, or paying off debts, Your Path focuses on your future and meets you where you are at.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment -OR- email mcum@mcum.org for more information
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Ability to commit to a 2-year program -- Willingness to meet with a coach regularly

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides a three-day supply of food to residents of Monroe County. Cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products, diapers (infant/toddler and adult), and vouchers for clothing and household goods from Opportunity House thrift store are also available.
site_details: Walk in -- Applications available online for delivery of nonperishable food items: www.mcum.org/ordernow
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri noon-4pm
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Experiencing a temporary financial crisis -- Assistance limited to: Food: once in a calendar month -- Diapers: once every 3 months -- Clothing vouchers: once every 4 months -- Cleaning supplies and hygiene products: once every 6 months -- Female hygiene items: once per month -- Returning clients are expected to make progress in reducing their need for future assistance.

site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri noon-4pm
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Experiencing a temporary financial crisis -- Assistance limited to: Food: once in a calendar month -- Diapers: once every 3 months -- Clothing vouchers: once every 4 months -- Cleaning supplies and hygiene products: once every 6 months -- Female hygiene items: once per month -- Returning clients are expected to make progress in reducing their need for future assistance.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides a three-day supply of food to residents of Monroe County. Cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products, diapers (infant/toddler and adult), and vouchers for clothing and household goods from Opportunity House thrift store are also available.
site_details: Walk in -- Applications available online for delivery of nonperishable food items: www.mcum.org/ordernow
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri noon-4pm

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - COMPASS EARLY LEARNING CENTER
service_description: Provides high-quality and affordable early childhood education to children between the ages of 1-5. The Compass Early Learning Center is a licensed, Path to Quality level 3 early learning center. The program accepts CCDF vouchers, On My Way Pre-K, and offers a sliding-scale tuition. Compass ELC is an emergent, play-based provider that utilizes The Creative Curriculum™ and Conscious Discipline™
site_details: Applications available online: www.myprocare.com/Default/EnterEmail -- Individuals will be contacted after submitting the application when an enrollment spot becomes available. -- Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Both parents/guardians must be working or in school -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Other special circumstances may be considered.

agency_desc: A nonprofit shelter for homeless families with children.
service_description: Provides an emergency shelter for single parents and couples with children. Clients receive case management and child-focused support programs.
site_details: Call for initial phone screening.
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Single parents, guardians, and couples (married, unmarried, or same-sex) with children (under age 18)

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 10am-noon; additional hours monthly 3rd and 4th Thurs 4:30pm-6:30pm
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Limit one visit every week

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_name: BEAN BLOSSOM TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: BEAN BLOSSOM TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers food pantries and various financial assistance programs to those in need.
service_description: Provides Monroe County households in need with vouchers for free clothing and household essentials from the Salvation Army thrift store.
site_details: Walk in during pantry hours to request a voucher.
site_eligibility: Low income/financial need -- Limit two clothing vouchers per household per year (vouchers allow 6 items per person); two $20 voucher for household essentials per year (such as kitchenware or bedding)

agency_desc: A nonprofit community center that provides a variety of services to people experiencing homelessness or financial hardship.
service_description: Offers point-of-entry services to assist individuals and families who are homeless or at risk of homelessness to move toward self-sufficiency. Provides showers, laundry facilities, phone, mail, and locker storage space. Personal care items, diapers, and formula may be available upon request. Case management services include assessment and referrals for shelter, housing support, medical or mental health care, and in-house employment readiness training. Orientation and assessment are required to access some services.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Day Center: Daily 8am-4pm -- Case Management: Mon-Fri 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Persons experiencing financial hardship or homelessness -- Open service area, with preference given to Monroe County residents

service_description: Offers an overnight, sober shelter for homeless men, women, and transgender people. The shelter is open for guests of the shelter from 5:15pm to 7:45am everyday, and guests need to leave the shelter outside of these hours. Support services include case management, job search assistance, locating stable housing, and information on community resources.
site_details: Entry is determined based on residency, need, past use of the shelter, bed availability, and other factors.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Must be sober -- No active arrest warrants -- Priority is given to persons living in Monroe County

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 10), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Monroe and Owen County.
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older, or any age with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

agency_name: BLOOMINGTON SOCIETY OF SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SERVING MONROE COUNTY
agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing financial assistance and furniture and appliances to those in need.
site_name: BLOOMINGTON SOCIETY OF SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SERVING MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Provides donated furniture and appliances free of charge to those in need. Fans and air conditioners are often available. Aid is determined by home assessment. Supplies vary; waiting lists may exist for some items.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail for a return call within 48 hours. -- Visit the website and complete request form, click "I Need Help" tab
site_eligibility: Financial need/hardship (based on individual assessment) -- Not helped with furniture in the past six (6) months.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MONROE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Monroe County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call for information about the next Homeowner Information Session.
site_eligibility: Lived or worked in Monroe County for at least one year prior to application. - Household income within range published on website (updated annually) – Demonstrate a need for housing, ability to pay a low cost mortgage and a willingness to partner with Habitat.

agency_desc: A nonprofit providing structured living environments, outpatient treatment, education, and recovery services to individuals with addictions and substance abuse issues.
service_description: Offers transitional housing and supportive services for men with chemical dependency or gambling addictions. Residents receive weekly case management while in the program. The average length of stay in this program is four months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to download an application or walk in to the main office (645 North Walnut   Street) to pick up an application. -- Submit application (drop off at main office, fax, or mail to PO Box).
site_eligibility: Men 18 or older with chemical dependency or a gambling addiction -- Sober for at least 2 weeks prior to entry -- Actively seeking employment -- Willing to participate in all program activities

agency_desc: A nonprofit providing structured living environments, outpatient treatment, education, and recovery services to individuals with addictions and substance abuse issues.
service_description: Offers transitional housing and supportive services for women with chemical dependency or gambling addictions. Residents receive weekly case management while in the program. Children under 6 years of age are permitted to live with the client at the women's facility with staff approval.  Priority is given to pregnant women and women who are IV drug users. The average length of stay in this program is four months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to download an application or walk in to the main office (645 North Walnut   Street) to pick up an application.* Submit application (drop off at main office, fax, or mail to PO Box).
site_eligibility: Women 18 or older, with or without dependent children (up to age 6) --With chemical dependency or a gambling addiction -- Sober at least 2 weeks prior to entry -- Actively seeking employment -- Willing to participate in all program activities

agency_desc: A nonprofit, high-volume spay/neuter provider.
service_description: Provides low-cost spay and neuter services for dogs and cats.
site_details: No walk-ins; call during office hours to schedule the surgery. Pets must be on leash or in a carrier when arriving for their appointment.
site_schedule: Office/Scheduling: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm -- Spay/Neuter Services: By appointment only (Drop-Off) Mon-Thurs 8am; (Pick-Up) Mon-Thurs 3pm
site_eligibility: Cats and dogs -- At least 2 months old -- At least 2 pounds in weight

agency_desc: A nonprofit, high-volume spay/neuter provider.
service_description: Offers low-cost vaccinations for cats and dogs, including the rabies vaccine. The walk-in clinic also offers microchipping, flea/tick treatment, heartworm testing and treatment, FIV and FeLV testing, and nail trimming. Spay and neuter services are also available by appointment.
site_details: For vaccinations or other wellness services, walk in during clinic hours. (Appointments are required for spay/neuter services only.) Cats must be in carriers and dogs must be leashed.
site_eligibility: Open (cats and dogs only)

agency_desc: A nonprofit, high-volume spay/neuter provider.

site_details: For vaccinations or other wellness services, walk in during clinic hours. (Appointments are required for spay/neuter services only.) Cats must be in carriers and dogs must be leashed.

agency_desc: A municipal agency that provides services that promote safe and affordable housing.
service_description: Offers HUD-certified housing counseling to current and prospective homeowners. Services include pre-purchase classes and individual counseling; mortgage default counseling to people who are facing foreclosure or are behind in payments; reverse-mortgage counseling and other alternatives for seniors. First-time homebuyers who complete a two-day educational program may qualify to receive up to a $10,000 grant for a down payment and closing costs.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Housing Counseling: Living in the city of Bloomington -- Reverse Morgage Counseling: Living in the city of Bloomington -- Must be 62 or older for reverse mortgage counseling

service_description: Offers financial assistance to low- to moderate-income Bloomington homeowners for critical, emergency home repairs that affect the health and safety of the occupants (leaking roof, nonworking furnace/water heater, broken water pipes, and electrical problems). agency_desc: A municipal agency that provides services that promote safe and affordable housing.
service_description: Provides grants to pay for modifications to owner-occupied homes, mobile homes, or rental properties for people with disabilities and/or older adults who live within Bloomington city limits. Eligible modifications include ramps, safety steps, bathroom renovations, improved lighting, levered door and faucet handles, and other improvements that will make a home safer and more accessible. A grant of up to $9,000 is available for eligible homes and up to $3,500 for rental units.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Bloomington.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Choice Voucher program in the city of Bloomington in Monroe County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. Persons already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list is currently closed. Visit the website for application information. -- No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_schedule: Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Income guidelines will be reviewed once application reaches the top of the wait list. -- Preference is given to persons with disabilities, working families, veterans, persons experiencing homelessness, and victims of domestic violence.

agency_desc: A national, nonprofit organization that provides fundraising assistance and family support for children and young adults who need a life-saving organ transplant.

site_eligibility: Age 21 or younger -OR- Any age if transplant is needed due to a single gene disorder such as cystic fibrosis or sickle cell anemia -- In need of a life-saving organ, bone marrow, cord blood, or stem cell transplant

agency_desc: A local government agency that handles animal-related issues for the city. The animal shelter also works with the county to provide some services countywide.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items include cat and dog toys, treats, canned or dry food, and bedding, as well as paper towels and non-clumping cat litter. Volunteer opportunities to assist with shelter duties may also be available.
site_details: To Donate: Place item in outside bin or walk in. -- To volunteer as a foster: Complete online application and training. -- To volunteer in-house: Complete online application or send email to animal@bloomington.in.gov.
site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Age 16 or older (Ages 13-15 years-old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian during duration of volunteer time)

agency_desc: A local government agency that handles animal-related issues for the city. The animal shelter also works with the county to provide some services countywide.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, micro-chipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Responds to reports of sick or injured wildlife and picks up dead animals that are in public roadways.
site_details: To visit the shelter: Walk in during designated hours. -- To report an animal violation or stray: Call to make a report or request assistance from an Animal Control Officer.
site_schedule: Shelter: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm; Sat 8am-4pm for strays -- Adoption Walk-ins: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri noon-4pm; Sat and Sun noon-3pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. --For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Public transportation provider serving Bloomington, Indiana.
service_description: Offers curb-to-curb, on-demand transportation services for people who are unable to use the Bloomington Transit fixed-route bus system due to disability. Vans are equipped with wheelchair lifts and take passengers to and from any location within Bloomington city limits.
site_details: Call for more information about fare and passes.
site_schedule: Main Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm Bus Service: Mon-Fri 6am-11:30pm; Sat 7:30am-9:30pm; Sun 9:30am-7:30pm Downtown Terminal (3rd and Walnut) Mon-Fri 7am-11pm; Sat 8:15am-6:30pm
site_eligibility: Living in Bloomington -- Unable to use the fixed route system due to a disability

agency_desc: Public transportation provider serving Bloomington, Indiana.
service_description: Offers public bus transportation along set routes within the city of Bloomington. All busses have wheelchair ramps/lifts, wheelchair securements, and bike racks.
site_details: Call for more information about fare and passes.
site_schedule: Main Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm Bus Service: Mon-Fri 6am-11:30pm; Route times vary -- Downtown Terminal (3rd and Walnut) Mon-Fri 7am-11pm; Sat 8:15am-6:30pm
site_eligibility: Living in Bloomington

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. The program consists of four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then 12 monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free after the second prenatal appointment and first year of the baby's birth may qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at participating Walmarts. Support partners who attend monthly meetings after the baby’s birth and remain smoke free are also eligible for a $25 diaper voucher each month.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Monroe County residents. Regulates septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information or to file a complaint.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Monroe County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Monroe County Health Department contracts and partners with the Indiana Recovery Alliance to offer the Monroe County Syringe Service Program. The program provides harm reduction materials and free, confidential, HIV and Hepatitis C testing for persons in need. Information and referrals are available for HIV and Hepatitis C treatment and addiction counseling services.
site_details: Call for information about testing, treatment resources or help to sign up for insurance. -- Walk into the health department for a list of syringe service program locations.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

site_name: MONROE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT - FUTURES FAMILY PLANNING CLINIC
service_description: Offers family planning services on a sliding scale, including pelvic exams and Pap tests, pregnancy tests, sexually transmitted disease/infection testing and treatment, HPV vaccinations, HIV testing, and birth control counseling and supplies (including pills, injection, IUD, condoms, and emergency contraception).
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Tues 11am-3pm and 3:30pm-7pm; Fri 9am-noon
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, volunteer-operated program serving meals to residents who are homebound or have disabilities in the city of Bloomington.
service_description: Delivers hot, midday lunch and cold sack dinner to homebound seniors and those with disabilities in the city of Bloomington. A physician's diet order is required; special diets can be accommodated. Financial assistance may be available for those who qualify. Service is not available on weekends or major holidays and delivery times are not guaranteed.
site_details: Call for an eligibility assessment.
site_eligibility: Homebound due to age or disability

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Monroe County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, call the Juror Message Line.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims that are $6,000 or less. In Monroe County, Division IV and Division VIII handle small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in for claim forms or obtain on website.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Monroe County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Monroe County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Monroe County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

site_name: MONROE COUNTY CLERK - CHILD SUPPORT & MARRIAGE LICENSE
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: By appointment only, call (812) 349-2614. -- Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Monroe County.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY CLERK - CHILD SUPPORT & MARRIAGE LICENSE
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Bloomington in Monroe County.
service_description: Offers a dollar-for-dollar match, up to $27, to recipients of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) when purchasing Indiana-grown fresh fruits and vegetables at this farmers market. Qualifying purchases must be made with a Hoosier Works electronic benefit transfer (EBT) card with SNAP benefits.
site_details: Walk in to this location during listed hours and swipe a Hoosier Works EBT card to receive double the SNAP purchase (up to $27) on Indiana-grown fresh fruit and vegetables.
site_eligibility: With Hoosier Works EBT card with SNAP benefits to pay for purchases

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency working to improve the health status of the communities it serves by making quality health and health-related services accessible to all.
service_description: Offers comprehensive primary health care services including family practice, pediatrics (well-/sick-child care and immunizations), internal medicine, physical exams for school/sports/work, and laboratory testing. Dental services include preventative care, fillings, crowns, X-rays, sealants, and more. Mental health evaluations/counseling, limited social services (including crisis intervention and referrals to community resources), and health insurance enrollment assistance are also available.

site_schedule: Health Clinic: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-5pm; Tues 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-1pm -- Dental Clinic: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Monroe County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply for the waitlist.
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Administers a weatherization program to reduce energy consumption and individual heating costs for persons in Brown, Monroe, Morgan, or Owen County. Typical services include conducting an energy audit, adding insulation, sealing air leaks at doors and windows, and inspecting the furnace. Heating systems may be replaced. Assistance is based on household income and availability of funds.
site_details: Call office for availability and to apply. -- Visit https://www.insccap.org/pages/wx to download application.
site_eligibility: Household income may not exceed 200% of federal guidelines

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Provides payment assistance for a water bill on disconnect notice for eligible persons who receive water service from the City of Bloomington Utilities. Persons must apply for the Energy Assistance Program to qualify for water assistance.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment if you have applied for the Energy Assistance Program. -- Apply for the Energy Assistance Program
site_eligibility: With a water bill and disconnect notice from the City of Bloomington Utilities -- Household income may not exceed 200% of federal poverty guidelines  -- Have applied for the Energy Assistance Program

site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Also provides prenatal and early childhood support through a combination of home-and center-based programming that blends parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Head Start: Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- Early Head Start: Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age 3 -- For Extended Day Head Start or Early Head Start: All adults in household must be in school, working, or in a vocational program -- At or below 100% of Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 13
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers a variety of pro-choice prenatal and post-pregnancy resources.
service_description: Offers support to women through all phases of pregnancy and parenting. Free pregnancy testing is available. Referrals are provided for abortion resources, adoption services, breastfeeding support, maternity housing, or other prenatal care services. Condoms are available.

site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 10am-5pm -- Supply Pickup: Wed noon-7pm; by appt only

site_schedule: Texting and website: Daily 24 hours -- Pickup: Wed noon-7pm; by appt only
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County. -- With a child in the home in need of diapers

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers a variety of pro-choice prenatal and post-pregnancy resources.
service_description: Offers financial assistance for persons seeking abortion services, but do not have the means to pay for the procedure. Funds are pledged directly to the medical clinic. The amount of assistance varies based on the cost of the procedure. Limited availability.
site_details: To apply, visit https://alloptionsprc.org/hoosier-abortion-fund/, call, or text 812-727-4423. -- When leaving a message or text, be prepared to leave the following information: first name, phone number, appointment date, how many weeks pregnant you are, best times to reach you, any phone safety concerns, and if the Hoosier Abortion Fund can leave you a message. -- Hoosier Abortion Fund can help cover costs of an abortion in another state (for persons living in Indiana). -- If you qualify for a legal abortion in Indiana, Hoosier Abortion Fund can help cover those costs as well.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women living in Indiana-- Seeking termination of pregnancy -- Priority goes to women over 10 weeks pregnant

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs. A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.

site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A department of Bloomington city government that oversees parks, greenways, trails, and recreational facilities and programs for the city.
service_description: Offers an exercise facility with various classes, fitness equipment, and an indoor walking/running track. Membership is not required to participate in exercise classes or sports leagues.
site_details: Walk in or call for more information.

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A department of Bloomington city government that oversees parks, greenways, trails, and recreational facilities and programs for the city.
service_description: Offers a variety of free activities for adults 50 and older, including volleyball, folk dance, foreign language instruction, lap quilting, aerobic exercise, and games.
site_details: Walk in. Call or visit website for schedule of free events.
site_eligibility: Age 50 and older

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry for persons in need.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food, such as meat, bread, and produce, to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Doors open one hour before posted hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Limit one visit every seven days

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry for persons in need.
service_description: Delivers nonperishable and perishable food, such as meat, bread, and produce, to those in need who are homebound or ill or who have a disability or no car. Limited service area. Delivery availability is dependent on resources available and demand.
site_details: Visit the website to submit a delivery request no later than 5pm the day before the delivery is desired. -- Delivery availability is NOT guaranteed; call to confirm availability.
site_eligibility: Living in Bloomington or Ellettsville -- Homebound, ill, have a disability, or have no car -- Limit one visit or delivery every seven days
